snippet: As friction worsened between French investigators and the Malaysian authorities, the victims’ families questioned Malaysia’s truthfulness in the matter.
abstract: Critics charge Malaysian government with mishandling news that investigators searching for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 had found a wing part; say government made early and unsubstantiated claims that link to missing airliner had been confirmed; situation has worsened government's relationship with investigators and reignited frustrations among family members of victims.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong; Aurelien Breeden from Paris; Nicola Clark from Ustica, Italy; and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia. Adam Wu, Kiki Zhao and Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: As friction worsened between French investigators and the Malaysian authorities, the victims’ families questioned Malaysia’s truthfulness in the matter.

headline.main: Malaysia’s Declarations on Flight 370 and Plane Debris Further Dent Its Credibility
headline.print_headline: Malaysia’s Declarations on Plane Debris Further Dent Its Credibility
